citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an up to date record/inventory of animals on hand. Each exhibitor must maintain records of
animals on hand. Records of animals on hand can be important for animal health tracking purposes. Ensure to update
and maintain records of exhibit animals.

The facility does not have written plan for the care of animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. A written
contingency plan is required for exhibitors and helps plan and act for the care of animals in an emergency. Ensure to
develop and document a contingency plan as required.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by August 19, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility does not have an up to date record/inventory of animals on hand. Each exhibitor must maintain records of 
animals on hand. Records of animals on hand can be important for animal health tracking purposes. Ensure to update 
and maintain records of exhibit animals. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility does not have written plan for the care of animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. A written 
contingency plan is required for exhibitors and helps plan and act for the care of animals in an emergency. Ensure to 
develop and document a contingency plan as required. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by August 19, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
